page.title: 05NEWMILL FARM - DOLPHINTON
page.content: Arable crops are barley (spring sown), turnips, rape, kale, potatoes, rye and triticale. Grass is conserved for winter feeding as silage or hay. Spring barley is sold for malting or stock-feed. It receives 3cwt of 30N 40P 40K fertiliser per acre and is treated with funcicide and herbicide sprays. Rye and triticale are grown in small amounts. They are sown in Sep. grazed in Spring by sheep and harvested in Sep. Rape and swede turnips are used for lamb-fattening and winter keep for ewes. Kale is used as late autumn grazing for suckler cows. Department of Agriculture and Fisheries for Scotland grow virus-free potatoes on one farm by micropropogation in glass-houses. Clones of these are sent to farm "raisers" in the North of Scotland to produce V.T.S.C. Seed potatoes.
